decks.notes: This deck is focused on quickly dealing damage to the opponent by utilizing low-cost aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, along with direct burn spells like Boros Charm, Rift Bolt, and Lava Spike. The deck aims to pressure the opponent with a fast tempo, while also disrupting their game plan with Eidolon of the Great Revel. By efficiently using burn spells and creatures, the deck can quickly reduce the opponent's life total and win the game before they have a chance to stabilize.

This deck aims to quickly deal damage to the opponent with cheap, efficient burn spells and aggressive creatures. The key is to apply constant pressure and force the opponent to react, while also preventing life gain with cards like Skullcrack. The deck's strength lies in its ability to quickly close out games before the opponent can stabilize, utilizing a mix of direct damage, haste creatures, and efficient removal to maintain tempo and control the pace of the game.

The main concept of this Aggro - Death's Shadow deck is to control the opponent's hand and graveyard while using cards like Mishra's Bauble and Serum Visions to cycle through the deck quickly. The deck also aims to bring out powerful threats like Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler early in the game, backed up by cards like Stubborn Denial and Fatal Push for removal. By constantly surveilling the graveyard and applying early pressure with high-powered creatures, this deck aims to control the board and overwhelm the opponent in a fast-paced manner.

Utilize a variety of spells and control cards to disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up your own win conditions through card advantage and efficient removal. Utilize planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and powerful spells like Cryptic Command to control the game and outvalue your opponent. Use Snapcaster Mage to recycle spells from your graveyard and efficiently deal with threats on the board. Aim to control the pace of the game and outvalue your opponent through efficient use of your resources.

The main concept of this Modern Living End deck is to cycle through your creatures quickly, possibly by using Street Wraith or Horrors of the Broken Lands, and then cast Living End to bring them all back from the graveyard onto the battlefield. By using cards like Violent Outburst and Demonic Dread to cascade into Living End, you can quickly overwhelm your opponent with a large army of creatures. Additionally, cards like Fulminator Mage and Beast Within provide disruption for your opponent's game plan, while cards like Faerie Macabre help you control their graveyard.

This deck focuses on taking extra turns to gain advantage over the opponent. It utilizes cards like Time Warp, Temporal Mastery, and As Foretold to continuously take extra turns, while also controlling the board with cards like Cryptic Command and Snapcaster Mage. The deck also includes card draw spells like Serum Visions and Ancestral Vision to help find combo pieces. The goal is to out-tempo the opponent and win through incremental advantage gained from extra turns and card advantage.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with cards like Faithless Looting and Burning Inquiry to enable powerful graveyard recursion cards like Bloodghast and Flamewake Phoenix. The goal is to quickly deploy threats like Hollow One and Gurmag Angler while using cards like Edge of Autumn to keep the cards flowing. The aggressive playstyle of the deck is supported by Lightning Bolt and Collective Brutality to clear the way for your creatures to get in damage quickly and efficiently.

The main idea of this deck is to efficiently ramp up mana using the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Mine) and other mana sources like Chromatic Star and Sphere, in order to quickly play powerful Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog and Wurmcoil Engine or planeswalkers like Karn Liberated and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The deck also includes cards like Relic of Progenitus and Ghost Quarter to disrupt the opponent's strategy, while Oblivion Stone provides a board wipe option. Overall, the key strategy is to control the game through powerful threats and disruption.

The focus of this deck is to put pressure on the opponent quickly by playing efficient creatures and removal spells. The deck aims to control the board by removing opposing threats while also gradually depleting the opponent's resources through discard spells. With a mix of powerful threats like Tarmogoyf and resilient planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil, this deck aims to overpower the opponent and win the game before they can stabilize. By combining aggression with disruption, the deck seeks to dominate the game and secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing the graveyard as a resource to quickly fill it with cards like Stinkweed Imp, Prized Amalgam, and Bloodghast. By dredging cards like Life from the Loam, the deck aims to constantly fill the graveyard while also generating value from cards like Faithless Looting and Cathartic Reunion. The key goal is to set up a powerful combo turn where cards like Narcomoeba and Conflagrate can be utilized to deal massive damage to the opponent in a single turn, often overwhelming them before they can respond effectively.

The main idea behind this UR Control deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats with burn spells, and transforming Thing in the Ice into a powerful finisher. The deck focuses on card advantage and tempo, utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and versatile spells like Cryptic Command to outvalue opponents. Blood Moon is included as a disruptive element to disrupt mana bases, while Snapcaster Mage provides additional utility by flashing back key spells from the graveyard.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence by playing aggressive human creatures like Thalia's Lieutenant, Mantis Rider, and Reflector Mage. Aether Vial is used to cheat these creatures into play at instant speed, while cards like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient creatures while utilizing cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to slow down their opponent's plays. The mana base is designed to support the tribal nature of the deck, allowing for consistent casting of human creatures.

The key concept of this deck revolves around leveraging the synergy between creatures with disruptive abilities and mana ramp to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Collected Company and Path to Exile to control the board, while also taking advantage of creatures with abilities like Spell Queller and Selfless Spirit, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and beat them down with efficient threats like Knight of the Reliquary and Scavenging Ooze. The mana base provides flexibility and access to a variety of colors to support the aggressive strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize cards that allow for graveyard manipulation and self-mill in order to quickly fill the graveyard with creature cards such as Prized Amalgam, Narcomoeba, and Bloodghast. By continuously dredging cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Thug, the deck can bring back these creatures from the graveyard and trigger powerful abilities. This allows for explosive plays and combos that can overwhelm the opponent and secure the win. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Faithless Looting and Conflagrate to further enable the combo potential.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Mine) to generate a large amount of mana. By using cards like Expedition Map and Sylvan Scrying to find these lands, the deck can quickly ramp into powerful threats like Wurmcoil Engine, Walking Ballista, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck also includes control elements such as Oblivion Stone, Karn Liberated, and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to maintain board control and deal with threats. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats while controlling the game.

This aggressive Naya Zoo deck focuses on playing efficiently costed creatures and burn spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. Utilizing cards like Wild Nacatl, Goblin Guide, and Reckless Bushwhacker, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben helps to slow down the opponent's spells while Atarka's Command provides versatile options for reach or pump spells. With a mix of creatures and burn spells, this deck aims to apply consistent pressure and close out games before the opponent can stabilize.
